column5: Well I spent the weekend dragging my balls around Lake simcoe before you get the wrong idea I ment cannonballs. I hit the lake friday with a friend who has been doing very well for lakers in the summer on simcoe. He gave me a few tips and I was ready to try it myself on the weekend.  The laker bite can be tough in Simcoe during the summer. I had tried pulling Nk's around with no results despite tons of marks on the finder. This weekend we decided to try my friends technique of bouncing bottom with the riggers. what a difference.  Saturday we went 5/5 and sunday we went 7/11  taping the flutter spoons seemed to make the difference. fish went from 3-8lbs some fought very well even peeling some line. only snapped a few pics as we released a bunch at the boat no to do any more damage.  Ryan
Some really nice fish there Ryan. Nice of your bud to help you in the tips department and good on you for keeping an open mind and trying something different. Thanks for sharing that, GREAT!
Nice looking fish Ryan i will have to get out there and try that  Rob
Awesome looking fish!  Great to see a change in tactics pay off like that for you.  Sometimes fishing does feel like your dragging your balls all around the place.....LOL
Some well fed troutsies!  Thanks for posting.  Nice little tidbit of info there.  HD
Nice job with the Laker's. No small feet catching those bad boys on Simcoe in the summer. Congrats and thanks for the report and pics.  Cheers, 1leg
Great report and pics Ryan  Real nice lakers for sure and thanks for sharing! Leechman
Great report Ryan.Keep it up thx
dude, you better start calling me
Nice fish! I used to bounce bottom on simcoe for lakers.  Really gets them going.  You can lose the odd cannon ball though.  $$
Nice job Ryan! I see you and the Lund are getting together quite nicely
Very nice! I thought the lakers in Simcoe were small, but those are some very chunky fish!! Thanks for sharing.
Some great lakers you got there. Mine are all small. Can't seem to get any decent sized ones. See you on the lake.   RR
Nice looking Trout Ryan.  Looks like a nice time out there.  Joey
